alert.note: Alert for Nobles; Rock (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 3:23PM CDT until July 05 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR LYON...NORTHWESTERN SIOUX...ROCK...SOUTHWESTERN NOBLES... MINNEHAHA...LINCOLN...MCCOOK...NORTHERN YANKTON...SOUTHEASTERN HANSON...TURNER AND EASTERN HUTCHINSON COUNTIES... At 322 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Colton to near Chancellor to near Mayfield, moving east at 50 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR SIOUX FALLS, CROOKS, COLTON, AND BALTIC. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. These severe storms will be near... Tea, Lennox and Davis around 330 PM CDT. Harrisburg and Worthing around 335 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Baltic, Centerville, Dell Rapids, Lake Alvin State Recreation Area, Ellis, Sioux Falls, Crooks, Renner, Canton, Beresford, Newton Hills State Park, Brandon, Garretson, Inwood, Sherman, Fairview, Palisades State Park, Corson, Hudson, Alvord, Rowena, Rock Valley and Valley Springs. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
